title: undefined reference to thread local variable in generic function

labels.name: A-linkage
labels.description: Area: linking into static, shared libraries and binaries

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I tried this code: ```rust #![feature(thread_local)] #[thread_local] static FOO: usize = 0; fn generic_fn() { println!("{}", FOO); } fn main() { generic_fn::(); } ``` I expected to see this happen: the code compiles and runs Instead, this happened: the linker fails with "undefined reference to `bug_thread_local::FOO'" ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.46.0-nightly (118b50524 2020-06-06) binary: rustc commit-hash: 118b50524b79e565f017e08bce9b90a16c63634f commit-date: 2020-06-06 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.46.0-nightly LLVM version: 10.0 ```
